div.l: AT trumpyngtoıı̄un not fer fro Canterbrigge
Ther goth a brook and ouer that a brigge
Vppon the which brook ther stant a melle
And this is verrey soth that I ȝou telle
A meller was there dwellyng many a day
As ony pecok he was proude and gay
Pipen he couthe and fisshen and nettes bete
And turne coppes and wel wrastle a shete
Ay bi his belt he bare a long panade
And of a swerd ful tranchaunt was the blade
A Ioly popper bar he in his pouche
Ther was no man for perel durste him touche
A Sheffeld thwitel bare he in his hose
Rounde was his face and camuse was his nose
As piled as an ape was his sculle
And he was a market beter atte fulle
Ther was no wight that durst hand on him legge
But if he he swor͗e he shulde anoon abegge
A thef he was forsothe of corn and mele
And that a sleigh and vsaunt forto stele
His name was hoten deynous Symkyn
A wyf he hadde comen of noble kyn
The ꝑperson of the toun hir fadir was
With hir he ȝaf ful many a panne a bras
For that Symkyn shulde in his blood allie
She was fostred in a Nonnerie
For Symkyn wolde no wyf as he seide
But she were wel norishid and a mayde
To sauen his estat and ȝomanrie
And she was proude and pert as a pie
A ful faire sight was it vppon hem two
On haly daies biforn hir wolde he go
With his typet wounden aboute his hede
And she cam aftir in a gyte of rede
And Symkyn hadde hosen of the same
Ther durst no wight clepen hir but dame
